alert.note: Alert for Caroline (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 03 at 7:31PM EDT until July 03 at 8:30PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Sussex County in southern Delaware... Southern Kent County in central Delaware... Southeastern Caroline County in eastern Maryland... * Until 830 PM EDT. * At 730 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Griffin to near Hurlock to near Secretary, moving east at 35 mph. This storm has a history of producing destructive winds in Talbot County, MD. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Georgetown, Milford, Seaford, Denton, Millsboro, Laurel, Harrington, Federalsburg, Milton, Bridgeville, Delmar, Dagsboro, Ellendale, Smithville, Gumboro, Agner, Andrewsville, Harmony, Sycamore and Griffin. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
